Wisdom: مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ ذِكْرِ الْآخِرَةِ قَلَّتْ مَعْصِيَتُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever increases his remembrance of the Hereafter, his transgression reduces

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحَبَّ الدَّارَ الْبَاقِيَةَ لَهِيَ عَنِ اللَّذَّاتِ
enWisdom: One who loves the everlasting abode becomes oblivious to [worldly] pleasures

Wisdom: مَنِ اشْتَاقَ إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ سَلَا عَنِ الشَّهَوَاتِ
enWisdom: One who yearns for Paradise forgets his [worldly] desires

Wisdom: مَنْ أَشْفَقَ مِنَ النَّارِ اجْتَنَبَ الْمُحَرَّمَاتِ
enWisdom: One who is afraid of hellfire keeps away from that which has been forbidden

Wisdom: مَنْ خَافَ الْعِقَابَ انْصَرَفَ عَنِ السَّيِّئَاتِ
enWisdom: One who fears [divine] punishment desists from evil actions

Wisdom: اسْعَوْا فِي فَكَاكِ رِقَابِكُمْ قَبْلَ أَنْ تُغْلَقَ رَهَائِنُهَا
enWisdom: Strive to free yourselves before your ransoms are blocked

Wisdom: مَنْ هَالَهُ مَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ نَكَصَ عَلى‏ عَقِبَيْهِ
enWisdom: He who is frightened by what is in front of him retreats [and flees]
He who is certain about the place of [final] return does not act treacherously
Remembrance of the Hereafter is a cure and a remedy
